children.title: Vice President's Recommendations for Federal Appointments
Oversized Items Sent to the Vice President

finding_aid_filing_title: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Vice Presidential records, Central Files, Series 3
finding_aid_title: A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller, Vice Presidential records, Central Files, Series 3

subnotes.content:
Processing Level 1: Basic processing has been conducted by Harold Oakhill, March 1994, to establish initial intellectual and physical control, address any immediate preservation concerns, and facilitate access to the holdings. Further processing of the records will be considered in the future, as necessary.

Materials remain in original record cartons and folders.

This guide provides file level description. Each file may represent multiple folders.

RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of U.S. copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provide in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection or tems within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

Detailed finding aids for each series of this collection are available:

<extref href="../FA377/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Vice Presidential Records, Richard Allison (FA377)</extref>

<extref href="../FA379/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Vice Presidential Records, National Commission on Water Quality (FA379)</extref>

<extref href="../FA380/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Vice Presidential Records, New York Office (FA380)</extref>

<extref href="../FA381/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Vice Presidential Records, Joseph E. Persico (FA381)</extref>

<extref href="../FA382/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Vice Presidential Records, Press Releases (FA382)</extref>

<extref href="../FA383/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Vice Presidential Records, Speeches (FA383)</extref>

<extref href="../FA384/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Vice Presidential Records, Working Papers of the Vice President (FA384)</extref>

<extref href="../FA385/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Vice Presidential Records, Foreign Affairs and National Security (FA385)</extref>

President Gerald R. Ford nominated Nelson A. Rockefeller to fill the vacant vice presidency following the resignation of President Richard M. Nixon in August 1974. Rockefeller served as Vice President from December 19, 1974, to January 20, 1977.

Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at <extref href="http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php">http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php</extref>

Series 3 Central Files is arranged as follows:

Subseries 1: Name Files, Boxes 70-162.

Subseries 2: Subject Files, Boxes 163-201.

Subseries 3: Chronological Files, June 26, 1975 - January 19, 1979, Boxes 39-48, 58-60, 68.

Subseries 4: Invitations, Boxes 19-22, 49-54, 202-208.

Subseries 5: 1976 Presidential Campaign - Schedules and Invitations, Boxes 209-211.

Subseries 6: Trip files, Boxes 23, 192-197.

Subseries 7: Speeches, Boxes 189-192.

Subseries 8: Vice President's recommendations for federal appointments, Boxes 57, 61.

Subseries 9: Oversized items sent to the Vice President, Boxes 18, 25-38, 55, 56, 69.

Subseries 10: Mail Returned by the Secret Service, Box 15.

Subseries 11: Control Slips and Control Cards, Boxes 212-215, 218-223.

Subseries 12: Correspondence Form Manual, Box 224.

The Central Files series contains the general correspondence of the Office of the Vice President from Nelson A. Rockefeller's tenure (December 19, 1974, to January 20, 1977). The series offers partial documentation of Rockefeller's role in the development of national policy and his duties as President of the U.S. Senate. There is correspondence with President Gerald R. Ford and members of his staff, congressional representatives, senators, other government officials, and foreign dignitaries. However, there is very little in this series documenting actual policy formation. Much of the correspondence with government officials concerns the Vice President's information-gathering activities on behalf of the White House and executive agencies, as well as his support of the President's policies. There are also reports and position papers on national issues submitted to the Vice President by individuals both within and outside the federal government. Virtually all of these were unsolicited.

Also documented here are Rockefeller's campaign activities on behalf of President Ford and Senator Robert Dole in the 1976 presidential campaign.

The bulk of the correspondence consists of letters from U.S. citizens expressing their opinions on issues, inviting the Vice President to speak at events, asking for autographed photographs of the Vice President, or asking for the his assistance in securing an appointment to a federal agency or a military academy. The responses to such correspondence were written by the Vice President's staff.

Carbon copies of outgoing correspondence are filed in the name, subject, and chronological files. Routine incoming correspondence is filed in the name file, while incoming correspondence of significance was photocopied and filed in both the name and subject files. The chronological file contains only outgoing letters.

revision_statements.date: finding aid revision date not supplied
